newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt's Suez Cement ups profits in H1.
newsitem.headline: Egypt's Suez Cement ups profits in H1.

text.p: Suez Cement of Egypt said on Wednesday its net pre-tax profits increased 3.42 percent to 151.02 million pounds in the first half of 1996, from 145.79 million in the same period of 1995.
The company's revenue rose in the first six months of the year by 9.27 percent to 271 million pounds from 248 million in the first half of 1995.
Total shareholders' equity declined to 530.72 million pounds on June 30, 1996, from 669.50 million a year earlier.
Sales in the period were worth 237 million pounds, compared with 216 million in the first half of 1995, it added.

State-owned National Bank of Egypt (NBE) will sell all or most of its shares in Suez Cement through global depositary receipts in a sale led by ING Barings, brokers and businessmen said on Wednesday. It holds about 15 percent of the shares.
The company has a market value of about two billion pounds ($600 million), with 49 million shares and a market price on Wednesday of about 42.00 pounds a share.
